review: Love this place! Only once did we experience bad customer service (not just bad, horrible) and when we went to the manager she didn't care at all! Not cool because we are definitely frequent customers. (That's why I'm taking a Star away) Love the happy hour wings! Burgers are great and beer is always a plus. What makes this restaurant over the top though is the never ending fries! So good.
This place was very unprepared. The tables were not set and they ran out of plates. Really??!!!

Usually this place is good...tried the new smokey campfire tavern burger, was ok. Our fries weren't cooked. Very slow service by Tina, had to ask repeatedly for drink refills, sweetener, ranch.. Exhausting...lunch time service
Love this place! Bartenders are always super nice and attentive!! Great food! Our usual go to for a night out!

Went there last night for a meal as I was in the area taking care of some business. Got seated within 10 minutes. Christina was the waitress. Very pleasant woman and eager to make sure everything was ok. Placed the drink order. Got a serving of fries while waiting and placed the food order. Food came out after a bit. I got the Chili Chili Cheese Burger. I was a bit disappointed in the burger. There was some chili on it, but nothing as claimed on the menu. I hate to say it, but I've had better chili cheese burgers at some off beat places like Apollo Burger. The fries at RR are always good. I like the larger thicker cut fries. I also like to add the Red Robin seasoning to my fries. The drink was great. It was the raspberry cream. Christina even made sure that I got one to go.  Gave a 3 star based on Christina, the fries and the drink. If it weren't for those 3, I would have left something far less.
The food was good and the service was even better. Tina was are server and she did a good job. I would recommend this place.

FOOD POISONING! Had the burger, on the way home I started getting really sick and had to spend the next day in bed and miss work. I should have known the meat was bad, it tasted odd. Reminded me of those really cheap burgers you get at a gas station on a long road trip through the desert but worse. This is one red robin to avoid!
Great service! Server recommendations were perfectly spot on. Had a margarita. Loved the ability to order multiple drinks from the electronic pad without having to flag down the server.

I've been to plenty of Red Robin's and even this one several times. It's normally a pretty decent experience aside from the fact that you are grossly overpaying for burgers and fries. Tonight however was not a good experience. Our server didn't know what he was doing, that was obvious from the get go. We had to ask for everything, even napkins and utensils.       So I order the chili chili cheese burger as I often do. Now, keep in mind, they have the nerve to say chili twice in the name, like you're actually going to get a scoop of chili on your burger at the very least, not to mention this is a $11 burger. The menu also says "served open face with chili piled high." Like I said, I've been to plenty of Red Robin's and order this often and that's normally what you get. Tonight my burger was almost void of chili at all. The wife and I also ordered 2 of the most expensive drinks on the menu, only to be duped into buying  $16 worth of ice.        I'll be back to Red Robin, but probably not this one for a while.
Worst Red Robin we've ever been to. Service, food and their French fries were terrible. Did not match up to other Red Robins at all. Disappointing meal on the drive home from Vegas.

The only redeeming portion of our meal was the server Stephanie. She went out of her way to fix the screw ups of the mental giant & Michelin rated cook working the grill. I state this as she had to send the burger we ordered back twice as apparently the company doesn't provide training as to what "medium rare" is. Both times the burger was cooked to death and had the mouth feel of going down on a corpse.  After 2 fails she went out her way to apologize for the situation which was not her fault, and comped the entrée. It was a sad situation that she did this on her own, given this was a text book situation for the manager to handle however, management must have been busy handling all 14 customers in the entire restaurant at that time. Other locations seem to care about what they serve howver, for this location,  mediocrity and apathy are the bar.

I love the decor and the service is so fast but the place is tiny inside. I can't believe how close the tables are to each other. The high chair at the table next to us was so close that I couldn't get out of the booth and the little girl kept touching my table.

Christina was on point with her service we never once had to ask twice... She was very helpful and made my brothers birthday a great and easy one I appreciate great customer service... Love the food to it was very good... I call it like I see it and she is a great waitress /server taking care of her customers with a smile

It was pretty good. I have never been to Red Robin. The service was mediocre. The lemonade dessert thing was not good. My burger was awesome though. I got the big pig something or rather. The garlic fries are awesome! Garlic aoli not so awesome. The servers need to be more active with the customers though.

Red Robin burgers can't be beat! Doesn't matter what you choose, your taste buds will thank you. We showed up today after a very long day at the doctor and wait time was 20 minutes, ugh. But Destiny jumped in after seeing us all tired out from hour after hour of waiting at the doctor's office. Guess it was obvious we weren't in the mood to wait. She managed to juggle things around and get us seated in 5 minutes. Thank you Destiny for going above and beyond!

Very slow seating. There were two parties ahead and plenty of seating and it took them 15+ minutes to sit us. Took the waiter ten minutes to help us once sat and food is taking forever to come out.  Lack of proper staffing is the problem. Understaffed restaurants make the customers like myself upset.  Won't be coming back to this location again.
Absolutely love it here every server is so friendly and attentive. I come here often the servers start to remember you. It's a really clean and fun environment.
Food is excellent. Whiskey BBQ chicken wrap, can't go wrong. Disappointed on the portion size of the artichoke spinach dip, especially for the price. But it is one of my absolute favorites.

Couldn't have been happier with the service today. Went straight to the bar area and my friend and I seated ourselves.  We were greeted quickly and our drinks were brought to us in about a minute.  We knew what we wanted and ordered without menus. The meals were brought to us in about 6 minutes. Very fast. I asked for BBQ sauce and the waitress brought me the BBQ sauce and ranch dressing. So glad she read my mind because I'm an idiot, I meant to order ranch not BBQ sauce. She kept our drinks full and checked on us just the right amount of times. We finished our food and drinks, but stayed an extra hour catching up because we hadn't seen each other in a while. Staff was super friendly and didn't try to push us out. Absolutely loved it and will definitely return soon.  Food was great. I ordered the BBQ chicken wrap with endless fries. One serving of fries was enough though.  Join the rewards club. It's worth it.

Came in today for my birthday.  Our server was Christina and she was awesome,sooo polite and just the best server I think I have ever had here...Awesome job Christina Thanks for making my dinner so wonderful..Red Robin should hire more of you  Everyone next you come to Red Robin ask for Christina she's the best..

Yesterday visited the Victorville location as Red Robin indicates it can accommodate food allergies such as Celiac.   This location along with the Apple Valley one are far from this.   1) when asking for an allergy menu they provided a business card with a bar code that must be scanned for the menu 2) the potential food with allergy is supposed to be cooked and prepared separately to avoid cross contamination.  The food came out on the same service as other food with cross contamination 3) the manager is supposed to bring out the food which did not happen Service was barely knowledgable and did not do a great job.  We waited 24 minutes for drinks from the bar.  The lunch was also slow.    Will not come back as my wife did become glutenized. 8/5 update.    After contacting Red Robin they have helped restore trust by taking immediate customer action. I have spoken with a Regional Manager and he has spoken to the local sites.   He was understanding and thoughtful.  While it maybe a bit before we are back I am impressed at the corporate customer service.  Confidence renewed.

Since moving to the mall location, service and food has been hit and miss.  Servers always seem rushed or stressed or something.  Can't quite pinpoint it.  None of the old wait staff transferred to the new location.  Unfortunate because they had several great waiters/waitresses. Most of the time the food is served up correctly and at the proper temperature.  If they feel that you've been waiting too long and appear irritated, they'll off you a basket of fries. ? During the summer, sitting alongside the windows that open inward is a nice touch.  We generally sit in the bar because one can feel forgotten when sitting in the main restaurant area.  I do like the addition of the all-you-can-eat broccoli.  Kudos for this.   Entrance/Exit by the bar is a bit awkward as it's one pathway for both.  Someone needs to check on the ADA requirements of that.   p.s. I do not require an ADA accommodation; I'm all about compliance and equality for all.

If you would like to spend your entire afternoon at a restaurant, then this is the place.  We were told the wait would be 20-25 minutes.  An hour later we were seated.  Lots of open tables, perhaps not enough servers.  The manager took our order, then we were told the shake machine was frozen and our shakes would be delayed by 10 minutes.  Next we were told that the Mac and cheese would be delayed as well, but the manager would comp is for the Mac and cheese.  Fifty minutes later our food arrived.  Good food, but not worth the nearly two hour wait to finally revive our food.

We had good experience at Red Robin in Victorville.  We had lunch there while we were waiting for Lenscrafters.  Burgers was good and can't beat the unlimited fries.  We also had the onion rings which are juicy and crispy.  Only problem we had was that they didn't have any eggs.  We also got a salad and its wasn't so great.  Just stick to the burgers.   It's the best.  We enjoyed the experience so we vlog about it.

Love this place!!! Had lunch here on Monday, November 9, 2015. We had an awesome server. Tended to my every need and was very polite, accurate, friendly, and fast. Ordered mozarella sticks, a bacon cheeseburger and fries. My appetizers came out quickly. Hot and delicious. There wasn't the normal 4 or 5 like other restaurants, there was about 8 or 9 , enough to share with my friends. The burger was very tastey, you can't go wrong with a bacon cheeseburger! Bottomless fries where delicious. Being 4 months pregnant, all I am craving is fries!!! Server kept our drinks and fries filled without asking! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anybody who has been living under a rock and hasn't tried it. I will definitely be back soon!!!

Waited 10 minutes just to be greeted by the Hostess. A couple before us was already waiting before us. Got our Appetizer before we even got out drinks. Waited 45 minutes for our food. Then my food was cold. Pressed the Button on the Kiosk. When the Waitress finall comes over. Says Whats up guys. Horible Customer Service. Sent it back. But then the couple across from us came after us,  ordered after us and already got their food. Which was probably Hot.

Red Robin is my favorite restaurant but I did not enjoy this one. It was my birthday yesterday and it wasn't any busier than it normally is. We asked for a booth. The lady said it would be a 20 minute wait. So we waited the 20 minutes and we DID NOT EVEN GET A BOOTH. We told her we asked for a booth and she replied with "oh I forgot because I didn't write it down". So whatever we just got that table. Gave us the wrong drinks, and took 30 minutes for just the appetizers to get to our table.  We said it was my birthday and the waitress brought me my sundae. The ice cream was melted, very little whipped cream, and 2 sprinkles. While the table next to me also had a birthday but their waiter brought them a perfect sundae.
Had a good meal service was great ! Servers were prompt and courteous. Food was hot and fresh.

To start my review off Lalo the front door greeter that takes names completely ignored us as we walked in and 2 other parties walked in after us he literally ignored us told them there wait would be 5 minutes and told us our wait would be 10 to 15 minutes how? When we were ahead of them! I hope the food is good or else Lalo might just make red robin lose our business I might just have to make a trip to fudgeruckers in Ontario. My mom literally had to go greet him in order for him to acknowledge us... You need to hire people with more customer service skills... I have never had a bad experience here and we are regulars.

Why has every Red Robin become a Sports Bar? Why must they 'push' booze? Why do they lead us to the 'bar' area without asking? Why act like life is one big Party!?! Why can't families feel like a family instead of bystanders at a hip hop?  Sorry! We just thought it would be nice to have a good meal and be on our way. Didn't mean to interfere with the big tipper you missed.

Nothing has ever tasted "badly", but nothing is ever too far above "average", and if it weren't for bottomless fries (If/when they are a fresh, generous portion) there are far better places to eat the same type of food for the money. For burgers, as this is the namesake: Stick to the "Reds Tavern Burger", or Reds Tavern Double" as its the same taste and fills you up just as much as the so called "gourmet" burgers, but for a few dollars less. Skip the overpriced soft drinks and appetizers, and don't bother with the cheap tasting salads.   If you're dying for a good salad for dinner, swing by Dennys (not joking)...They have a prime rib (or chicken) salad with spring mix (can be subbed for romaine, which Red Robin doesn't offer), and generous portions of toppings for around $9 or $10 bucks and less expensive drinks. The Red Robin salads don't even measure up. Please don't waste time and money in this area of the menu. Spend $10 or less on your entree, be sure your meal comes with bottomless fries,  and you most likely will get your dollars worth. Service is acceptable, but like the food, can be very inconsistent... Once I was seated, with my party of 3 and weren't addressed at all for over 20 minutes (not really busy, and many servers walking by).  Needless to say. We left. Other times I've been met with friendly, attentive staff who seem to know their menu, but have hesitated to "recommend" anything, commenting that it's hard to do so knowing how much certain items cost. Take the advice written above, and you'll be satisfied with a triennial casual visit.

Cane for dinner 5/4/14 waited about 30 min. To be seated. About 15 minutes to get our orders in and another 35 minutes for our meal. .  Wow, horrible customer service,  understaffed and very bad experience.  Will definitely not return to this location.  Management is doing a poor job handling patrons and staff.  I recommend the location @ Jess Ranch. Seriously disappointed on the service I expected.
There was 6 in our party and all of the checks were all wrong and had to be reprinted 3 times.  The meal was fair at best.they very confused  and under staffed.

I arrived there wanting my usual endless root beer float. The waitress informed me that she couldn't make it because her ice cream machine was broken. She can't make anything with ice cream. In fact, it's been broken for over two weeks and she doubts it will ever be fixed. She told me that every time it is used, metal shavings go into the ice cream. Fine, ice cream maker is on the fritz, I get it. Then why is it that she was able to make 3 ice cream sundaes and serve them to tables around me? She was also the worst. She brought out my pretzels, forgot the cheese. By the time she gave me the small tub of cheese, the pretzels were cold. The cheese was coagulated. I never got my fries, even when my burger was served. For some reason unknown to me, my fries came after the burger was served. I never got a refill on my glass of water. I had to call over another server to get my water refilled. I will not come back here.

Went here with a big party (23 people) on 1/20 at 3pm.  We called ahead for the tables and figured they should be quiet at that time.  We found the place packed.  Short wait of 10 mins and we had our table in the back section of the restaurant.  Great location for 10 adults and 13 kids.  We knew what to expect from RedRobin and thus selected to eat here.  However, biggest problem we had was they only assigned one server to us.  Bless his heart, he did his best to serve us, but one guy is just not enough. He took the kids orders first and did a great job of getting it in.  However, their drinks came out separately.  Some came from a drink station (first), the rest came from the bar.  This gap was separated by at least 10 mins.  Made for unhappy kids ("why did she get hers first...").  He came back and took the adults orders and drinks.  Most RR would bring out the fries first (since they are bottomless)...we didn't get our fries til after our entrees came out.  When the kids food came out, there were a few mistakes.  NO big deal though.  Biggest deal was the delay between food (since he was the only guy bringing it out).  I can't blame him for our experience, but I expected more from RR.

Got together with friends for my wife's birthday here last night. I've never been a big fan of Red Robin. They change their menu too often (always eliminating my favorite dishes). Most of the menu is now burgers. My wife loves their guacamole bacon burger and seemed to enjoy it greatly. I got a "black & bleu" burger, which is one of their "premium" burgers. Not impressed. The amount of bleu cheese was minimal and was overshadowed by the pile of grilled onions and mushrooms (anytime bleu cheese plays third fiddle on a dish with bleu in the title, its a bad sign). My daughter had one of the eight actual dinners on the menu; riblets with mac 'n' cheese. She liked it, but didn't love it.  Service was excellent, and there was no wait to seat our party of eight on a Friday evening (you can draw your own conclusions about that). Altogether, the dinner was average for a premium price (if you're charging $15+ for a burger and fries, it needs to be special) and I'm still not a big fan.

They do it right here. If you want to a clean well-lighted place off the 15 in Victorville that is very kid-friendly, go here. No longer beholden to Olive Garden, and though I liked Steer and Stein, well, Red Robin just worked better.  The burgers were good, but beware they will not serve it to you below medium. This concerned me b/c I definitely like some pink and juice. Long story short, my burger came out way overcooked, they redid it, and comped my burger for the inconvenience. Service is unfailingly helpful -- and good lord, they love to give you refills on things (even the kids' meals entrees they refilled...)  And, it's not too expensive, either. Glad we tried it, and would definitely return.

Sometimes you go to eat somewhere and you're SO wowed that you have to let people know?!?! This is the OG Red Robin that i've been going to for 20 or so years. Parking sucks, always had, always will, but yesterday with Mark as our server, everything was awesome.  Mark is the kind of server that ALL servers should train with to see how to do a job. I don't know this dude, but i'd go back here just to have him wait on me.  Keep this dude Red Robin.......

I love Red Robin.  Now that the one has been open in Apple Valley, this one always gets us right in and sat.  Their food is always hot and fresh, I love that they are always keeping the good menu items and incorporating new items each time I go in.  I would have gave them 5 stars but they stopped serving Bass beer, so now I can't order my "Black & Tan's" like I used too.  Bring it back and you guys got yourselves a 5!!
Broccoli was moldy, burger was cold. bartender was too busy. Manager was no help even after food was sent back. Typical chain

Tried the $6.99 specially priced burger for lunch. The hostess was friendly but a bit disorganized in getting the names and order of arrival. The waitress and manager very attentive with the lunch rush crowd. Had our second batch of fries on the table even before asking a plus in my book. Would definitely give the other burger choices a try next time. My only negative was the waiting area was cramp and the area isn't that great. Parking was plentiful and centrally located at this mall.

We have been to the restaurants before many times actually. Friday dinner for the whole family was such a disappointment. Service was aweful although tour server was friendly she didn't cut well Enough enough for me not to talk to manager. 1. Service was slow. Lack of attention. Which lead to my second ..  2. Lack of attention . As we were yacking our burgers there was no tissues or napkins .  3. My wife requested a knife .. may I have a knife please .. 3x  and still no knife ..  4. Drink  wer not filled or no offers at all. Where is atuddor group and maybe they can show how to spark red Robbin !

Free burger coupon. Yea right! Shame on you for these deceiving practices I would have been happier with $1 dollar off instead is this trickery.  I had to buy 2 drinks at $3 each for that free burger a soda that cost 10cents.  No deal I blocked your coupons from my email.  My bill was $20.

Came here to meet someone. I was in the mood for a decent burger and Red Robin always had a decent burger. Well, that was until tonight. I don't know what it was but the burger I had was sub par. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't what I'm used too getting at Red Robin. I ordered the pepper something or other burger. When the waitress, who did a good job by the way, set it in front of me the very first impression was that the meat looked pale. Unappetizing. RR burgers are a more charbroiled color normally. Nothing else on the burger was appetizing either. I can't put my finger on why, it just was. The taste was ok, but not what I'm used too getting from them. Everything else was ok. Service was good and the place was clean. I would go back and give them another chance. It wasn't a bad experience. More like a little let down. Especially since I chose there to meet because I was in the mood for a decent burger. And for whatever reason I didn't get that.

I love red Robbin have never had any bad experience besides today I just moved to Apple valley and thought it would be equally good & it was NOT my food came back cold and my strawberry lemonade was water with strawberry syrup I will never visit this location ever again

What happened Red Robin.?,  Went for burgers and fish and chips after the new year and omg if I wanted to eat cold food I could have stayed home and saved $55.00. Being on a fixed income that was a lot of money wasted.. I'm sorry but won't be going back,  too expensive to eat less than supposedly gourmet food.  Shame on the cook and the management that allowed food to be served that they knew was not  cooked fresh and certainly not up to Red Robin standards.  With all the new restaurants opening,  Red Robin this is not the time to revert to making crap and passing it off as gourmet.   Really wish I had my $55.00 dollars back :(

I read all the reviews and didn't want to go at all, but it was my cousins birthday and that where she wanted to eat. It was on a Tuesday, 8 p.m and we had a waiter name "rekyah" (I think that's how you spell it) she was really nice and fast! I ordered this 14.00$ pepper burger (egg added) a 5$ strawberry lemonade (it has crack in it I know it) and bottomless fries.  My cousin ordered a chicken sandwich, boneless wings, and a small tower of onion rings.  All the food was great! Hot and fresh.  The bill was about 50$ and I had a Red Robin rewards of 10%. We will definitely come back.

This place ruined my favorite burger place I don't know if I can stomach Red Robbins after this experience first my drink had dried bread stuck to the inside of my cup so I get it changed out then I get my burger it's the wrong burger and so was my wife's so we decided to eat it just so we can leave and under my burger and on the sides of the plate was dried bleu cheese my burger had no bleu cheese so another dirty dish this place needs a health inspector to come here

Went by this location because it was close by and never had any problems at their  Apple Valley location but the service was terrible at this one. Nobody was at the greeting station and nobody ever came. Nobody even cared if we were there. So after 10 min of waiting we left and will never go back again!

Friendly staff  Very Good Food  .I highly recommend The Spinach and Artichoke Dip. They have never ending Fries and Beverages  And awesome desserts   Somewhat of a wait for a table on Fridays but you can usually find a seat or table in the bar area.

Basically an overpriced Carl's Jr. with a full bar, I don't hate it but I don't love it either. Wish we didn't wait 45 minutes for a table, 15 minutes for drinks and another 30 minutes for food. If you go here be prepared to wait a long time.

I think the only time I would come back is if in dire need. I came in with a girlfriend and we had to wait 15 min just to get a drink order! I'm assuming the server was swamped because he was never around! I went most of my meal without a drink refill, and our food came out cold.  Hopefully they give their servers less tables next time so he could pay more attention and give better customer service

We had such a great experience today and want to take time to share how great Rolando was. We were helped fast and he was attentive! We got our food and it was perfect the portions were larger today, in the last year RR had gone down with food portions. I don't expect Buffett portions but sometimes fries are skimpy! Not today RR is back!! And rolando made our visit wonderful! He brought the side of pickles and ranch with the food :) we didn't have to ask for silverware and he kept our glasses full  THANK YOU RR AND ROLANDO for a great lunch experience
Love this place always good fast and fresh. I have not had one bad experience here. Always fills you up. Love endless fries!!

We went here on a packed Saturday night, and didn't have to wait long on a table.  Our waitress, Stephanie, was super personable and attentive.  The food is what you'd expect, which is not to say it wasn't good.  People always have negative things to say about "chain restaurants".  You have a bad attitude going in, you'll always have a bad experience.  We've taken our kids to Red Robin for years.  They love it, and so do we.

Staff is always friendly and attentive. Food is always served hot and just the way I order it. Sports on Tv's. It's a win no matter how you slice it. You can never go wrong if you come here for lunch by yourself or with some friends.

If I could give it one star I would. My husband and I were driving from Las Vegas to California so we decided to order take out from here and avoid fast food. I called just as we were leaving Barstow and it said 30 mins on the gps to reach this location. I called and placed the order and the man said it would be ready in about 20-25 mins. I thought perfect. I ordered a salad so even if it sits there for 10 mins it will still be fine. When I arrived I went to the take out section and let the bartender know I had placed an order. He called over another lady who then printed me receipt. I explain I was paying with an E-gift card and she looked at me like she had never heard of such a thing. I explained to her how it works and she left to go process the transaction. She returned 10 minutes later and said one gift card wouldn't work. Finally when the payments went through she left again for another 5 or so minutes only to return to hand me the bag that's been sitting behind the bar the whole time. She starts to walk away forgetting that I ordered drinks. The whole time she is processing my payment and wandering around the bartender is standing there. He could have easily filled the drinks. As she starts filling them slowly they strike up a conversation on how excited they are to have the next 2 days off work and blah blah blah. Look, I've worked in customer service. It's exhausting I get it. But you really aren't busting your ass. Your location was dead when I was there and it took you 15 mins to process my payment and fill 2 drinks. So there conversations in front of a customer was just rude in my opinion. When we finally got on the road I opened up the food boxes and our "extra order if fries" was maybe 7 fries in total. Not even a whole potato. I am very disappointed in this visit so unfortunately I will never be back. We make the trip to and from California every other month so this would have been a great stop to fuel up on the drive but it appears we need to find another restaurant. I already posted my experience on social media so my friends who also make this trip regularly know to avoid it if they want a quick experience through the order out menu.
This place is beyond efficient. Came here today in the afternoon the waiter, and stuff or super attentive and the food was prompt and extremely fresh. Best Red Robin experience I've had.

Worst Red Robbin I have ever been to. Understaffed and unprepared. Never got endless fries even after asking multiple times. No drink refills and just felt ignored.  I visit the Glendale Red Robin on a weekly basis and have never been treated as badly.

Not bad! Second time here and this time ordered to go. Was coming home and was hungry but didn't want a full sit down meal. Since I had a gift card, I landed here. Decided to take home the NachosOMG from the bar menu and they didn't disappoint. Plenty of chips, cheese, chili, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, etc. But what was also impressive was the way the to-go-order was put together. Packaged in a nice container, put in a plastic bag with plenty of napkins, plastic forks, spoons and extra salsa. Also a nice touch was the jalapenos placed in a small container for those that don't like the spicy heat. Good job I wouldn't hesitate to return again.

This food is good. The staff is what makes this place awesome. Our waitress "Destiny" is the reason we come back. She always greets with a smile and does her best to remember our drink orders.  The burgers are what you would expect from a good burger place. This is not a 5 star restaurant but in the desert its nice to know there are places that try.

Again, as I came to find out on my last trip-gourmet burgers...my butt! The decor here is way different than other Red Robins, this one is newer but went for a vintage look with old movie posters and the old logo, not really feeling it. The whole place feels cold and there are so many too small booths, even though I doubt this place really fills up. We went for Jim day since my husbands middle name in James, he got a free Jim Beam burger. It didn't come with any sides, so he ordered the pound of spuds app which turned out to be just a basket of fries, I should have known but was expecting something better. He also got the california chicken sandwich but asked for it fried. The burger was ok, the chicken not so  much. I split two kids meals with my son, the veggie and the boca burgers, since both of those on the kids menu cost the same as the exact same thing on the adult menu. Both were gross, I have had boca and gardenburgers before but these tasted raw and stale, with no flavor whatsoever. The service was pretty much lacking, we had to flag her down for a refill and didn't even bother to ask for a second one. Same with the fries, I asked for a refill twice just to get one basket with about 5 fries for the 3 of us when we were finished eating follwed by the question if we are saving room for dessert, no, well heres your check. If I really wanted to eat at Red Robin again I would go to the one at Jess Ranch, this  one sucked.

This place is awful. Just awful. Everything sucks. The food is always cold, they always want to rush people out of the building. Kathy, the GM is a complete moron which is probably why everything from service to food sucks.

If you know me then you know I love cheeseburgers! I'm a cheap date...lol...forget the fancy stuff...get me a great cheeseburger and I'm good!! That said...I used to love Red Robin! It was somewhat of a burger heaven for me however, they keep changing and it's not for the better. I loved this location when it was on Mariposa but once they moved to the mall, it just wasnt the same anymore. Set up is weird...way too crammed and dark. They took off the wet garlic fries and now have dry garlic fries-disappointing. Ive been going to RR for YEARS (different locations) and I've tried almost everything on their menu. My fave- Mushroom burger, Candied bacon burger (fairly new), the ghost pepper burger(really really hot!! Ask them to hold the fresh jalepenos if you dont feel like having a wet face or a hot ass) The Hawaiian Hearthrob smoothie is the best smoothie I've ever had and recently my friend ordered the sweet potato fries and now I'm hooked on those too! Overall it's an ok place, the new location, decor and the new dry as the mojave desert garlic fries made me deduct a couple stars.

Waited 30 minutes to be seated on a Monday night when I was told 15 and sent a text that stated 20 mins.  When we were finally seated we waited an additional 20 minutes to have our order taken and then another 20 minutes to get our food.  This place was not that busy, totally unreasonable.

Service in the bar area not the best. I was there this past Monday so it wasn't like they were super busy. I was by myself and when I asked the bartender what good bars are around in the area she referred me to other chain restaurants such as Applebee's, Outback, etc in the near by areas... lol. I thought she would have asked me why not just stay there at her bar... HA!  Food was solid as always but really, how many of those fries can you really eat?

I love this place always a safe bet! Me and my wife always go there and enjoy our food and always leave full and satisfied the staff is always friendly and always checking up is we need anything. Best thing is to get the red robins royalty card there always giving away meals and discounts we love this place would recommend for a perfect date to go out to eat then the movies around the corner.

My husband and I stopped in on our way home from Vegas. The service was ok, and the manager up front was accommodating, but the bar was out of like 6 different beers.  Our fries were cold and only half  cooked. We both ordered a cup of the tortilla soup. I don't think either of us had even one piece of chicken in it.
First time here and I gotta say it was pretty good. Service is good, our server Amanda did a great job.

After a 3 hour drive to the high desert for a wedding, I was super tired and hungry. I received awesome service here. Our server Mark took great care of us and also was patient enough to take both our orders at the same time, as we took turns using the restroom. Both our burgers were delicious and I loved how I could substitute any burger with a veggie one.

Ever since they moved to their new location at the Mall of Victor Valley the overall service/experience has gone down. The service is very slow and the seating is awkward. They have tables for two in one dining area. The tables are small squares and big oversized chairs. It's uncomfortable to sit in them because you feel like you are leaning back while eating. Otherwise you have to sit straight up...basically you can't really relax. The booths in that area are not any better. The tables constantly slide all over the place. Unfortunately Red Robin has given in to the bar/hang out environment, there is a bar area, that should be enough.

Arrived at the new red robin in the mall on saturday 2/15 around 1:40.  Waited 45 minutes to be seated for a party of 6.  They will not put together tables of 2 with the red seats.  Ended up on the patio with these metal hard stools.  While the hostess took our drink orders to help the waitress out.  Took another 20 minutes to get the appetizers and then additional 30 minutes to get our food. We were all hungry by the time our main meals came out.  Don't know if they are still working out the kinks or are short staffed.  You would think they would staff more on weekends.  The food was very good  though and the waitress was nice.

The brand new Red Robin is beautiful. The restraint has a new modern feel. The staff is warm and friendly. It's continently located in the mall so you can "walk your food off". The root beer float was awesome. I just with they would have ore options on the meat. Maybe a Kobe or even something just a little bit leaner. I got the baja turkey club thinking it would less greasy but it wasn't. All in all great establishment and mediocre food.

I came here with the fam on 5/22/14 on our way back from vegas. Even though it was really busy the service we got was great! our server made sure our drinks were always full and refilled our fries constantly. Everything we ordered was delicious. .

We did not visit at a busy time. We were seated promptly but it was a while until our waitress showed up. We ordered our drinks and one had alcohol so it came from the bar. We order ordered onion rings (which were very good) when the non alcoholic drinks arrivrd. When the onion  rings finally arrived we said where is the drink from the bar? She said she told someone else to bring it to us and she guessed that they forgot. She finally went and got it. A long time to wait for an $8.00 drink. We ordered our dinners and waited a very long time for our food. 2 of us ordered french onion soup and it was so salty we could not eat it. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and I got it with no bacon. I let her know and she brought me 3 pieces of bacon right away. The bacon was not cooked enough for me to eat. We never saw our waitress again. This was the worst restaurant experience I have ever had and I am 68 years old! I live in the area and will never eat here again.

Red Robin is always a safe bet. I have never had a bad meal at Res Robin. I especially like the California chicken burger. This location met my expectations, the food and service were very good. I didn't give them a 5 because I was not wowed.

Clean and crisp, The service was awesome, We had salads..... a little cold from most likely being pre made and stored in the cooler, with hot chicken....  It worked for me A fast lunch, a fair price, nice atmosphere.

When this new location opened up I was so hopeful.  I love the fact that Red Robin offers gluten free bread because I am allergic to wheat.  When they get it right it comes out amazing, unfortunately this location always seems to miss the mark.  Nearly every time I have gone to this location they always mess up one order in the group.  At first I though "ok, we all make mistakes" but this has happened to me at least 5 times or more.  The food is usually good so I guess my main complaint here is the consistently bad service.  There are some gems  for servers in there but they are far and few in between.  Please Red Robin Victotville get it together because when it's good it's really enjoyable.
Stopped for late lunch.  Even though this is in a mall location we only waited a short time to be seated.  Service & food were excellent.

Was very good they got our orders right and the service was good. a lot noisier than when they were on the other side of I15 but way better parking. I liked the other location better it was laid out better and had a better feel. The staff was attentive and food was good.

I recently visited the new location and I have to say that the old location was so much better. This location has a feeling of fast food restaurant. I had lunch with a friend and the waitress ignored us the whole time. We literally had to stand up and walk to her in order to get our check. We started with drinks that took 20 minutes to arrive then we waited another 20 for our salads. We could see the kitchen from our table and we constantly saw our server eating and drinking in the back instead of checking on her tables. Horrible experience. There is only one good Red Robin up here now and that is the one in AppleValley.
So yes they are on the slow side but over all my food is always delicious and hot. Prices are good.service is fine...location is much better as well as ambiance.

Really impressed with this place. I usually go to the across town location seeing its close to the house but i was at the mall and the kid was hungry so we figured we cant go wrong with red robin so we ate here instead. The wait for a table was a little long and it seemed like a pretty small place the food and drinks came quick and the food was perfect! it all looked super good and tasted even better,

Went here on Saturday night for dinner. We went up to the host to give him our name and he asked me 3 times how many people were in our party. I kept saying 2. The third time he finally realized he was making me repeat myself and he said "Oh, I mean what's the name?" I gave him our name and asked if we could get a booth. He said yes so we went to wait in the mall entrance. About 40 minutes later we went back inside the restaurant and sat down because there was now nobody waiting. The host walked up and said "How many?" Like he had forgot we existed. I told him we already gave him our name and were still waiting. About 15 minutes later he said our table was ready. He walked us to a table and I said "Oh is there any way we can get a booth?" (While standing next to an empty one). He said it would be a few minutes. We waited another 10 minutes before we finally got to sit down. After we sat down we got lucky enough to wait another 15 minutes before the waiter acknowledged us. He kept "forgetting about us" the entire time we were there. He wouldn't bring us refills or silverware without first going to 3 other tables and then disappearing in the back only to come back empty handed and again ask us if we needed anything. The manager came by and asked how we were doing and she ended up getting our silverware and drinks. We also noticed the table behind us had to depend on the manager because this waiter was ignoring them too. Not sure if we will be back any time soon. Red Robin seems to be going down hill pretty quickly.

I was there about two weeks ago and we sat at the bar. Service was quick and our waitress, Valerie was very attentive. She always made sure our drinks were filled and always made sure the duration of our visit was pleasant.

Not loving the new location in the mall. The service is hit or miss, and my last trip they  took forever to come to the table to get the drink order and even longer to take our food order. My husband is vegetarian so he ordered a wrap without the chicken. The first wrap they brought had hair in it, when they brought the second wrap it had meat in it. Needless to say I will drive all the way to Apple Valley for better service next time.

THE WORST RED ROBIN IVE EVER BEEN TO. It took almost an hour to receive our order when the restaurant was entirely empty! When we finally received our food, it wasn't what we had even ordered! The sandwich itself was sopping in mayo- disgusting! I would have understood the mix up had they actually been busy but the waitress was so distracted and preoccupied with closing she the bar she failed to pay any attention to her potential tippers. Needless to say we ended up leaving without touching that disgusting food or paying for that matter.

Went there today for lunch at 11:30 they didn't have a table ready for four waited ten minutes or so for a table. Then no service nobody comes to our table they are walking past but don't stop not to say I'll be right with you guys nothing. This was my fist time at this location and it will be my last. We got up and left and went to Pancho Villas and had great service and food.

The service was good, the restaurant was clean and packed with people on a Friday night but the food left a lot to be desired.  I had the Chicken Ensenada platter and it was seriously the toughest 2 chicken breasts I've ever had in my life.  The seasoning was fine but I just couldn't cut this chicken to save my life.  The salsa also tasted a little strange to me but everyone else seemed to like it.  My husband ordered his burger medium rare, which was described as just a touch of pink in the center but the entire burger was bordering on raw.  Meh.  It know it's a chain but I've had much better at the Red Robin in Brea.

My boyfriend and I chose to eat at this location because our friends kept telling us that it was delicious.  They were right about the food.  It was delicious, but the service was HORRIBLE.  We went on a Friday night, which we expected it to be busy.  We got a table under 10 minutes.  The waitress was friendly, but her service was like I said, horrible.  We ordered, received our food and she asked us if we needed anything.  I had asked for another container of ranch, but before I could ask her for silverware, she took off.  We sat there for a good while before she came back - WITHOUT my ranch!  I saw her getting drinks for a few other tables.  I tried to get her attention and was ready to flag down another waitress, but she was busy as well.  FINALLY our waitress comes back and asks if we were ok.  I told her that she forgot my ranch and that we needed to silverware.  We sat there for about 20 minutes without silverware while our food was getting cold.  She never came back to see if we wanted anything else, which we had ordered fries....(Those ohh sooo good fries!)  She however did come back right before we were done to ask if we wanted a refill on our drink.  THEN, she comes back with our bill - which took her another 15-20 min to pick up.  I ALWAYS leave  a big tip because I know how hard waitress/servers work.  I didn't leave her one.

This place used to have such good service--then they moved across the freeway....They are always crowded nowadays and the restaurant is really cramped.  I feel that the location is pretty but it lost a lot of its original charm..  This last visit we ordered an appetizer and food.  We were sat in a corner and ignored--the upside was that we had a great view of the kitchen and could see our chips and salsa hanging out under hot lights...for 15 minutes...how hard is it to bring out chips and salsa?  That is like a no brainer fast appetizer.  Then our food was placed under said lamps as well.  My husband got up and went into the kitchen area to address the issue with a manager.  Our food was brought out and we were asked if we still wanted our chips and salsa?  What was the point?  The manager explained about a staffing issue and comped our meal as well as gave a gift card for a return visit.  While I appreciate the gesture we haven't been back since.

I AM NOT GIVING ALL RED ROBINS THIS ONE STAR RATING, JUST THIS ONE LOCATION. I went here a week ago with my fiance. It was about an hour till closing when we walked in to eat. We stood waiting for someone to seat us for a good 5-10 mins. Finally we are seated in the bar area and observed one waitress at the bar. She took about 10 mins to even greet us and ask for drinks. We waited for 15 more minutes before leaving out the door. She was hanging out letting some other chick grab on her and tell her how much she loves her. Her friends were loud and obnoxious and distracting her from her job. She never brought our drinks after being there for almost a half an hour. Very disappointed and was really craving some of those delicious steak fries.

Always a fan of Red Robin. Love a burger every now and then; they have promotions and if you register online, you'll receive coupons. I got a free burger for my birthday. Servers are really nice. There's a hostess who kinda reminds me of Taylor Swift.  Burgers - most are good depending on your craving  Chipotle chicken salad - good  Fries - order extra crispy, dip in ranch dressing

So, came here for my birthday lunch on May 5th...the place is clean and the staff is friendly....overheard us talking about it being my birthday and after we ate they brought me ice cream and sang the silly bday song without us asking for it......HOWEVER, my burger was cold and my friend's salad had chicken that tasted like fish, everyone else's food was fine....they did take the bad meals off the bill, plus a coupon for a free apetizer the next time.....the crappy part was that I got sick about an hour later, probably because of the burger...happy birthday to me, huh?

Red Robin is our 'go-to' place for just a good get together sit down relaxed place :) Very kid friendly a huge plus for our 5 kids :) They even give one free refill on the kids mac n cheese! Bottomless fries, bottomless garlic fries (which was good for my husband since I ate is LOL), bottomless drinks on several different ones. A lot of refills on different foods! Just ask your server its apparently a little known thing with a lot of the foods. I love the fact you can substitute a veggie burger for the regular burgers, I just wish they had a few more Vegetarian options (they used to have a stirfry, but it disappeared off the menu??) Their seasoning is addicting but im sure horrible for you. The atmosphere is fun and lively, tvs on sports, lots of fun stuff to look at on the walls :) A little over stimulating sometimes if your not ready for it lol The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because their burgers are a bit pricey and im holding out that 5th star til they had some more healthy vegetarian options :)

I will not be trying this location next time I'm in California. These two stars are for the nice corporate determined decor and a pleasant host. Key points: do not serve browned, day-old guacamole to three Mexican guests, we are definitely going to send that back in a heart beat. I'd expect an apology at least and move on but our waitress didn't seem to have it in her. Next up, my cousin-in-law (?) ordered a well done bacon cheeseburger ordered that came out with no bacon and rare at best. When she, assuming the best, asked our waitress if it may belong to another table, our waitress responded: "I put the order in right." Rude.  Her side of Mac and cheese came out as noodles with a top layer of cheese, nothing delicious to see here. Our wait staff was extremely unapologetic and the manager decided to make up for it by comping my drink (even though my main dish and sides came out just fine) and by showing us the order ticket that had gone to the kitchen to prove that the order was placed correctly. This seemed like a moot point given how the burger actually came out.

The food was great...I had the Oktoberfest Burger (which I'm pretty sure is just a seasonal item), and I absolutely loved it. The only complaint I have would be the time if took to finally take our order, and the time it took to get us back our check.
Really clean and great fast service. The burgers are good and the drinks are ok. Love the lemonade!
Awesome food... Always a great burger. You have to try the Royal Red (egg burger). Sounds funky but its not!

I've been to several Red Robins, but this one is the worst thus far. Not only was their gluten-free menu outdated by several months, but the servers had no idea what requirements are necessary for prepping a gluten-free meal. I ordered a burger without a bun, but my burger came with the bun intact. When I sent it back, instead of receiving a new order, the bun had simply been removed. I could tell because there were traces of bread stuck to the lettuce. Normally I would have returned it a second time, but because of time constraints and hunger, I took off the outer layers of lettuce and ate the ill-prepared burger. Needless to say, I became ill almost immediately after and for several days following that meal. I wish I could say the service was so poor because it was packed, but there was hardly anyone else in the restaurant; we went on a Thursday around 3 in the afternoon.

Not Bad, But Try Something Else This is another one of those restaurants that I used to visit on a regular basis.  However, everything that applied to my review of the Olive Garden applies here as well.  There are just better places in the same area.  Places where the food is more flavorful, the service is friendlier, and the prices are similar. Now, I normally like the food at Red Robin restaurants, but I had to dock a couple of stars for the last meal I had at this particular branch.  The burger was undercooked and still rather pink the in middle and the waitress got my friend's order completely wrong. While the mistakes would normally be forgivable anywhere else, with more competition in the Mall area, Red Robin really has to step up its game.  Needless to say, I don't plan on eating at this Red Robin again when there are newer, better burger joints nearby.

We showed up (with a reservation of course) with 30+ people. Girls soccer team with 14 teenage girls and parents and siblings in tow.  We were seated almost immediately. Based on experience of going to dinner with this group at other restaurants we prepared for a disaster. We received the complete opposite. They had an area already set up for us and provided two servers Carey and Melinda were awesome. they had us seated and drink orders taken before I could even think about it. Menu's where already on the table and as we were receiving our drinks the two waitresses were half way done taking orders. Our food was good and we got it fairly quick considering the size of our group. They also allowed us to do separate checks with each person on each check at different tables, with no incidents.  which does not ever happen, at least were we have gone.
